description.value:
With a gesture like opening a door, you create a passage through a solid surface or body of water.

Utility Spell

You create a passage through which creatures can safely travel, opening a gap in either a solid surface or body of water (or similar liquid). The spell cannot create a gap in organic material, moving objects, or creatures, though it can create a gap in a magical barrier such as @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.KdHgTZaQPRQOaTrB]{Wall of Force} or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-spells.Item.Al4cudyzaoFQ2V0u]{Forcecage}.

  • The passage can be as large as this spell's listed area of effect or smaller.

  • The passage can go in any direction, including upwards or downwards.

  • Passwall never causes structural instability or displaces material. Even if the hole created by the wall would cause a building to collapse, the building is stable as if the passwall was never created. This may cause things to float.

  • When the spell ends, anything inside the passage is safely ejected to the closest end of the passage, and the material originally displaced returns to its original location.
